|Description=extraparenchymal collection with fluid content, sometimes associated with recent bleeding, usually crescent-shaped, limited by the dural sinuses, and quite often bilateral.

Subdural haematoma '''([[Discovery of a brain abnormality on medical imaging examination SD-226|discovery of a brain abnormality on medical imaging examination]])''':

- extraparenchymal fluid collection in the meningeal spaces (between the dura and arachnoid)

- crescent-moon appearance, often bilateral

- hypodense on cerebral X-ray if the haematoma is chronic

- mixture of hypodense and hyperdense areas (fresh blood) in cases of recent bleeding

'''Insert figure 18.5 from the manual'''

question.title: Characteristics of a chronic subdural haematoma on medical imaging
question.description: What is a common feature of a chronic subdural haematoma on imaging?

option_a.title: Bilateral and crescent-shaped
option_a.description: An extraparenchymal fluid collection in the meningeal spaces, limited by the dural sinuses

option_b.title: Unilateral and crescent-shaped
option_b.description: A fluid collection in the subarachnoid space, often associated with recent bleeding

option_c.title: Bilateral and hypodense on cerebral X-ray
option_c.description: A mixture of hypodense and hyperdense areas, often with a crescent-moon appearance

option_d.title: Unilateral and hypodense on cerebral X-ray
option_d.description: A fluid collection in the subarachnoid space, often associated with recent bleeding and a crescent-moon appearance
